page.title: 05Sherborne St. John Plan
page.content: In October 1980 the Secretary of State for the Environment approved the North East Hampshire Structure Plan, which includes a local plan for Sherborne St. John. Consultations were held with County and Parish Councils, groups and individual members of the community about the draft proposals for land development in the period ending in 1988, in which 55 new houses are scheduled to be built. It is stated that wherever possible buildings of historic and/or architectural importance are to be conserved, along with the habitat and landscape. It also suggests there will be a need to develop shops to cater for villager's needs and additional recreation facilities. Traffic problems will also have to be looked at.
